comments.body: I'd prefer to simplify this script if possible, for example purposes. For instance, I think you only use this as an entry point with the mysqld command, so why not get rid of arguments to this script, and always conclude by executing mysqld with the arguments you've set up? Unless there are some best-practices that I'm unaware of here?
The reason for this is that this runs initially with arguments to bootstrap not only mysql, but to set up privileges and then subsequently runs using /etc/mysql/my.cnf

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +33,37 @@
# if the command passed is 'mysqld' via CMD, then begin processing. 
if [ "$1" = 'mysqld' ]; then
  # read DATADIR from the MySQL config
  DATADIR="$("$@" --verbose --help 2>/dev/null | awk '$1 == "datadir" { print $2; exit }')"
